summary: This document contains the official autopsy report, toxicology reports, neuropathology report, and anthropology report for Jeffrey Edward Epstein, detailing the findings from his death in custody. The reports describe injuries including fractures to the hyoid bone and thyroid cartilage, and conclude no toxicological substances were detected. This document appears to be a collection of suicide watch and psychological observation logs for an inmate, likely Jeffrey Epstein, based on the registration number and name fragments. It includes observation charts, meal/shower records, and chronological logs documenting the inmate's status, activities, and cell checks. This document is a collection of Bureau of Prisons administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, primarily concerning Jeffrey Epstein's incarceration and suicide watch status in July and August 2019. It includes inmate history logs, suicide watch observation logs, a property record, a daily lieutenant's log, and internal memoranda. This document contains the Metropolitan Correctional Center's daily lieutenant logs for August 9-10, 2019, detailing routine operations and the medical emergency for inmate Jeffrey Epstein on the morning of August 10. It also includes a psychology memorandum summarizing contacts with Epstein from his arrival in July 2019 until August 8, 2019, detailing his mental health assessments and suicide watch status.

Epstein was to need a cell mate upon Reyes's departure from the unit.

Both were inmates in the Special Housing Unit (SHU) at MCC New York around the same time, with Fernandez on dry cell watch.

events.title: Autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: The autopsy of Jeffrey Edward Epstein was performed by a medical examiner, with subsequent specialized examinations conducted over the following weeks.

events.title: Receipt of Toxicology Specimens
events.description: Blood and other specimens from Epstein's autopsy were received by the toxicology laboratory for analysis.

events.title: Neuropathology Examination
events.description: A neuropathologic examination of Epstein's brain and spinal cord was performed, concluding they were normal.

events.title: Anthropology Report Completion
events.description: The Forensic Anthropology Unit completed its analysis of Epstein's hyoid bone and larynx, documenting fractures.

events.title: Suicide Watch / Psychological Observation
events.description: Ongoing monitoring of an inmate (likely Jeffrey Epstein) under suicide watch or psychological observation, documented through regular checks, meal consumption, and shower records.

events.title: Epstein placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was placed on suicide watch at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.

events.title: Suicide Watch ended
events.description: Epstein's suicide watch status was stopped.

events.title: Epstein found deceased
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found deceased in his cell.

events.title: SHU Inmate Movement Memo
events.description: Staff passed information that inmate Reyes was leaving and Epstein would need a cell mate upon return from an attorney visit.

events.title: Daily Lieutenant's Log Entry
events.description: Log notes inmates Bright and Gentile on suicide watch with companions, and Ramos pending SHU bed space.

events.title: Epstein Found Unresponsive
events.description: At approximately 6:33 AM, inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was found unresponsive in cell Z06-220. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, and he was transported via ambulance to a local hospital with CPR continuing.

events.title: Epstein Placed on Suicide Watch
events.description: Epstein was placed on suicide watch after being found with a string hanging around his neck. He later told staff his cellmate tried to kill him, but during assessment denied remembering the incident.

events.title: Court Note on Suicidal Tendencies
events.description: Epstein returned from court with a note from the court indicating 'suicidal tendencies.' He was assessed and denied being suicidal, and was not placed on suicide watch.

events.title: Epstein Arrival at MCC
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center and was seen by psychology services for an intake screening.

events.title: Routine Correctional Operations
events.description: Daily logs detail routine operations including counts, equipment checks, inmate transfers, and monitoring of inmates on suicide watch, psychological observation, and dry cell status.

locations: 520 First Ave, New York, NY 10016 (Office of Chief Medical Examiner)
Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, New York
Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: The autopsy found fractures to the left greater horn of the hyoid bone and fractures to both the left and right superior horns of the thyroid cartilage.
Toxicology analyses on multiple specimens (blood, vitreous, etc.) detected no ethanol, drugs, or synthetic cannabinoids.
The neuropathology report concluded Epstein's brain and spinal cord were normal, with no evidence of disease or trauma.
The autopsy noted other findings including healed rib fracture, steatosis of the liver, and myocardial fibrosis.
The reports were finalized and signed by multiple forensic officials in August 2019.
The document is a suicide watch/psychological observation log for an inmate with registration number 76318-054, strongly indicating it is Jeffrey Epstein.
It includes detailed tracking of the inmate's meals, liquid intake, showers, and cell checks at regular intervals.
The logs specify strict protocols for items allowed during observation, such as safety toothbrushes, softcover books, and suicide smocks/blankets.
Multiple pages show chronological entries with timestamps, suggesting continuous monitoring over a period.
The document ends with a 'Suicide Watch Chronological Log' and 'Inmate Companions Log' cover page, indicating it is part of official prison monitoring procedures.
Jeffrey Epstein was on suicide watch from July 6, 2019, until July 23, 2019, at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Epstein's suicide watch ended on July 23, 2019, and he was found deceased on July 24, 2019.
A memorandum dated August 12, 2019, references a conversation on August 9 about inmate movements, indicating Epstein would need a cell mate after an attorney visit.
The Daily Lieutenant's Log for August 9, 2019, notes other inmates on suicide watch but does not list Epstein, consistent with his status after July 24.
An inmate personal property record for Epstein lists his property disposition, dated after his death.
Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019, and was transported to a local hospital with CPR in progress.

A psychology memo details Epstein's mental health contacts from July 8 to August 8, 2019, noting he was placed on suicide watch on July 23 after being found with a string around his neck, but consistently denied suicidal ideation in assessments.

The logs show multiple other inmates were on suicide watch or psychological observation (Gentile, Ramos, Felix, Williams) and one (Fernandez) was in a dry cell during the same period as Epstein's incarceration.
A handwritten note states 'MANDATORY ROUNDS MUST BE CONDUCTED EVERY 30 MINUTES ON EPSTEIN #76318-054 AS PER GOD!!!!', indicating a specific monitoring order.
The document provides a detailed timeline of correctional facility operations and inmate movements in the 24-hour period leading up to Epstein's medical emergency.
